intro: Ceropegia distincta subsp. haygarthii, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a trailing or shrub-like species, with fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in rock gardens.
